intro: Osteospermum namibense, commonly known as the Namibian osteospermum, is a flowering plant native to Namibia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features striking blue to violet flowers with dark centers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Osteospermum namibense is often found in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
